item.description:
STONY BROOK RESERVATION


We'll all meet in the parking lot of St. Crysostom's Church located at 4740 Washington St. West Roxbury at 1:00 pm.

For those interested in lunch we'll be dining at Dogwood Cafe at 3712 Washington St. Jamaica Plain, after the walk.


Stony Brook Reservation
Turtle Pond Parkway, West Roxbury, Hyde Park.
617-333-7404

Open year-round, dawn to dusk. Enneking, Dedham and Turtle Pond Parkways wind through extensive tree covered hills, valleys, rock-outcroppings and wetlands; past Turtle Pond and into Hyde Park. Stony Brook Reservation contains 475 acres of scenic landscapes and a variety of recreational facilities.

Ten to twelve miles of hiking trails and bicycle paths meander through the quiet, forested portion of the reservation. Sunfish and Perch swim in the fresh waters of Turtle Pond, an easily accessible spot for fishing. In the Reservation's southern section are soccer and baseball fields, tennis courts, picnic areas , an ice skating rink, and a pool.

Trail Map
View on screen | Download printable version (pdf)



Directions:
MBTA: Orange line to Forest Hills Station, MBTA bus (Dedham) to Turtle Pond Parkways.

By Car: From Washington Street at Forest Hills Station, 3 miles on Washington Street, towards Dedham, left onto Turtle Pond Parkway.
